lexUnit.name: toot.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to make a toot.

sentence.text: I could n't wait for him to get here and yet when he tooted his car horn I suddenly clutched Mum and did n't want to go after all .
When Feargal tooted his car horn , she said her farewells and went out to join him .
Somewhere outside the park a motorist tooted his horn , the anger muted by distance .
Wishing that her friend were sometimes not quite so outspoken , Laura suppressed a small sigh before they heard the noise of wheels crunching on gravel , and a car horn being tooted impatiently .
The program takes you on a drive with Noddy in his little yellow car around ToyTown , visiting friends , interacting with them and occasionally tooting your horn .
AT A drive-in church in Los Angeles religious motorists toot once for Amen and twice for Hallelujah .
She had seen him on the telly -- he had been on the early evening news tooting his trumpet .
It is essential in these cases to toot before overtaking .
Behind us an impatient motorist tooted a horn .
One day I was walking down Bedford Street in Belfast city centre and this bloke pulled over in his car and started tooting his horn .
You hear the rattle of gunfire here as often as you hear cars tooting their horns .
` I 've told her again and again to toot her horn before crossing the main corridor , " grumbled the Headmaster .
He went out to his car carrying his jazzy jacket and tooted as he drove away .
Nor were they concerned by drivers who tooted horns as they sped past .
Add a tablespoon of media and voila -- the perfect setting for two of the centres to toot their horns by claiming discovery of an analogue to AIDS in monkeys .
